author: Andre Maniam JC:
casenumber: General Division of the High Court — Suit No 264 of 2019
casename: KPMG Services Pte Ltd v Pawley, Mark Edward
counsel: Daryl Fong, Abhinav R Mohan, Annette Tan (Shook Lin & Bok LLP) for the plaintiff; Suang Wijaya, Genghis Koh (Eugene Thuraisingam LLP) for the defendant.

headings.text: Is Mr Pawley responsible to KPMG (S), as stipulated in clause 5.1 of the LOE?
The requirement that a promise of guarantee be in writing (or evidenced in writing) and signed by the guarantor
What is the effect of Mr Pawley’s signature on the LOE?
The nature of clause 5.1 of the LOE, and independent legal advice
Is the LOE a written and signed promise by Mr Pawley to be responsible to KPMG (S), or a written and signed memorandum or note of that promise?
Was there an oral guarantee from Mr Pawley (aside from Mr Pawley agreeing to clause 5.1 of the LOE)?
What is KPMG (S) entitled to recover from Mr Pawley?
Can Mr Pawley avoid liability by disputing time costs?
Is Mr Pawley’s responsibility limited to professional fees and not also disbursements?
Was KPMG (S) entitled to bill “fees” for work done by KPMG (US)?
Is KPMG (S) limited to US$470,000 in fees?
Are KPMG (S)’ fees unreasonable and disproportionate?
Does KPMG (S) need to make a demand against Bluestone, or exhaust remedies against Bluestone, before it can recover payment from Mr Pawley?
